intro: Malmea manausensis, commonly known as the Manaus malmea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks, contributing to the biodiversity of the region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
